sentence: I won't stand by while they try to take healthcare away from Texans  who need it most.
title: Republicans' Assault on American Arts, Culture, and Public Knowledge

sentence: If Republicans truly cared about pregnant women and families, we  would be debating how to undo their $1 trillion cut to Medicaid, which  rips healthcare away from millions of pregnant women, new mothers, and  children, and how to help the millions of women seeing their health  insurance premiums skyrocket due to months of Republican inaction.
title: Supporting Pregnant and Parenting Women and Families Act

sentence: But they can't hide from the fact that they are about to take  healthcare away from children.
title: H. Con. Res. 14

sentence: Speaker, it is bad enough that it gives massive tax breaks to  billionaires and wealthy donors, but it does that by literally taking  food out of the mouths of hungry seniors and children and ripping  healthcare away from more than 16 million Americans.
title: Providing for Consideration of H.R. Prohibiting Voting By Noncitizens in District of Columbia Elections; Providing for Consideration of H.R. District of Columbia Federal Immigration Compliance Act of Providing for Consideration of H.R. Protecting Our Nation's Capital Emergency Act; and Providing for Consideration of S. Halt All Lethal Trafficking of Fentanyl Act

sentence: The Senate should not pass a budget that rips healthcare away  from millions of Americans--60,000 of whom live in my State--just to  give tax cuts to billionaires, but that is what this budget will do.
title: Establishing the Congressional Budget for the United States Government for Fiscal Year 2025 and Setting Forth the Appropriate Budgetary Levels for Fiscal Years 2026 Through 2034

sentence: Well, let me tell you this: When you strip healthcare away from  290,000 New Mexicans, many of which are in my district, including  132,000 children and 26,000 seniors, can anybody on the other side of  the aisle tell me how is that making life better for my constituents  and for New Mexicans?
title: Concurrent Resolution on the Budget for Fiscal Year 2025

sentence: I also didn't come  here to vote for a bill that strips food out of children's mouths and  that strips healthcare away from the people that need it.
title: Better is Possible

sentence: When the President tried to take healthcare away, where were you?
title: Privileges of the Floor

sentence: Today, the fact is that we can do our jobs and, rather than take  healthcare away, we can actually help fix it.
title: Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: Republicans are stripping healthcare away  from 16 million Americans so they can give giant tax breaks to  billionaires and big corporations, two groups that don't need any help  right now.
title: Halt All Lethal Trafficking of Fentanyl Act

sentence: This will  take healthcare away from 11 million Americans and threaten rural and  intercity hospitals.
title: Department of Defense

sentence: If you take this healthcare away, people are just going to get  sicker.
title: H. Con. Res. 14

sentence: Republicans are choosing to take  healthcare away from moms and babies.
title: Women's History Month

sentence: That is taking healthcare away  from the disabled who need it.
title: Concurrent Resolution on the Budget for Fiscal Year 2025

sentence: This week and into the next couple, Republicans are  plotting to rip healthcare away from millions of Americans to fund tax  cuts for 759 billionaires.
